comments.value:
Hello

We are announcing details of our competition schedule in February.

A query here re whether we can do a searchable database of the 600 events to live within http://www.london2012.com/games/olympic-sport-competition-schedule/index.php 

Search fields: Date, Sport, Venue, Free text

The search interface would have to be very simple.

The results would be returned in pages of 20 sessions per page. Results would show Sport, Date, Venue and Session listings (i.e. all the things happening within one session).

I am hoping it would be able to reuse the type of functionality already in use in the ODA Business database....

Grateful for your thoughts on whether this is remotely feasible in the timeframe of release 12 Feb.

Thanks

Hi Morag,

A couple of quick questions,

Dates: I notice some event have multiple dates, some span periods and some are single days. Would it be possible to enter an entry for each (ie. similar to how you have them listed by day). So that if someone selected a sport or venue it would return a list of events just for that sport/event; maybe grouped by date, unless the search contained a date in which case it would just return a list similar to the current 'by day' list. That would certainly simplify things. But would mean one entry per day/event in the back end (maybe that is the 600 events? in which case does each event only occur on one day at one venue?)

Session: What is a session, is it an individual event on a individual day at an individual venue?

In terms of availability February is starting to look very busy for us, although saying that we are currently on top of workload and should have room to take this piece of work on, especially if we started now. But with the caveat that we'd need to be very firm on requirements / timescales. We probably won't have room to make lots of ad-hoc changes along the way. I mention this as I realise that if third parties need to add input, it may slow the work down, whereas if your making the final call I'm much less concerned (as your normally quick to respond with yes/no/you make the choice!)

In terms of work I'd imagine ~4 days work, maybe moving to 5 depending on how quick we get their with layout/design and whether ITS need to add in feedback/want to test on dev first.

- create backend object to hold competition events
- create interface to add / edit events
- create search form / page (based on simple list of dates, not a 2 field date range)
- create paginated listing page to display events (maybe grouped by date; need to think about how this would effect pagination) with search box.
- make search sticky for subsequent searches (ie. so users.adjust their criteria)
- develop and test on dev
- deploy to live
- handover

Jamie

Sorry for delay in responding to this.

Dates: I don't think this will do the job, as it doesn't really move us on from where we are in terms of information provision. I think we need to be able to generate results broken down by inidividual sessions. Each session takes place on one day in one venue, so we shouldn't run into problems with date ranges. You are correct that there would be up to 600 different event entries.

Session: a session is a morning, afternoon or evening session for which a ticket is sold. It might contain a series of events (e.g. two heats and a semi-final) or in the case of Athletics a mixture of events (e.g. 100m heat, shot-put final, discus qualifying).

February: I appreciate that this month is going to be very, very busy, and that there wouldn't be time to make changes to the spec. We would have to sign this off on the piece up front. NB I'm not intended to get the search or results interfaces designed - do you think page designs would be necessary? We would also need to allow time to test functionality / input content / check the content, which adds to the timeline.

Timescale - 4-5 days work sounds okay to me in terms of cost (there is also the resource overhead on our side in terms of inputting content). When in the next few weeks do you see this work as likely to take place? I would want this to happen sooner rather than later, in order to give us time to populate the tool.

I need to get Alex to sign off on this as it has been instigated by him (can you tell this is not my favourite project....)

Thanks so much for this information - will get back to you asap!

morag

Hi Morag,

Dates: I think *I* may have clouded the issue, if the individual entity (ie. a record) is a "session" which only happens on a single date, at a single venue in the morning/afternoon/evening, then that's perfect, in that it makes life much simpler in building the search.

We probably wouldn't start in earnest on the front end till the end of Jan, with the main build being the first week of Feb. 

Although we could create the entry page for you this week so you could add the sessions.

Just so I (and everyone else) is clear:

1) Backend: Entry

You will create a session record which contains these fields (it main contain other but these are the ones you'll search on)

	- name (a single sport?)
	- date (this will be a single day)	
	- morning/afternoon/evening (this will be a pulldown, you can't have morning+afternoon or 'all day')
	- a venue (this will be a single venue)	
	- do you need a freetext/description field?

2) Display / Search:

You will be able to search on the above sessions using the following rules/form elements:

	- freetext (name/venue/freetext field?)
	- date this will be a pulldown of all dates? (or would that be to many dates? would we need a calendar widget? or day/month pulldowns)
	- venue (do you need a pulldown of venues? if this information that someone would search on?)
	
I assume you don't need a morning/evening/afternoon checkbox as the results by that point will be narrowed down enough (although we can add if you think it will help).

Personally I'd work towards keeping the search options as simple as possible (assuming that that simple criteria returned a sensible result on the first page), average users tend never to use advanced search options.

As you say timing are very tight, we'd have absolutely no room for any thing other than small tweaks and we'd probably have to keep the search simple ie. date ranges are always more time consuming to debug than a single date pulldown. That's not saying we couldn't' do it, but we should probably keep the requirements to 'essential' rather than 'it would be nice if it could.."

Jamie

Thanks, Jamie.

Re: timings, having the entry page this week would be massively useful - the sooner we can start on this the better...

In terms of data entry - is there anything we can do by way of uploading a spreadsheet or does it all have to be manual?

Backend entry - I will confirm these fields asap. It's complicated so I want to check this is right.... 

Display/search - Date - pulldown of all dates is fine - a calendar is not reuqired. I don't think we need a 'from / to' - a single date should be fine. Again, I will check.

Venue - yes, a pulldown would be required and people shoudl be able to search on it.

Morning/afternoon session - agree, I don't think we need this

Agree we need to keep search simple - the data is complex enough.

Am coming back to you asap on this - thanks so much for your help!

H Morag,

I have create a little entry interface here for you along with the necessary back end stuff to store the records.
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/pages/editform/competitionsessions

Just click + to create a new one.

I added both disciplines and sports, can you let me know which taxonomy is the correct one (or do you need both?)

Is this what you are after?

If you have a spreadsheet we could look at writing some code to load it in. If you have 600 events I can see why this is useful! Although we don't have an off the shelf interface to handle Excel imports, so it would probably take a day to get something written / tested. The Excel (or CSV) file woudl also need to be well structured, ie. all the values woudl need to match up both in name and case etc. and ti woudl be a one time import (unless we cleared out all the existing record each time).

Let me know your thoughts.

Jamie
Spent a day so far on research, creating a competition template, taxonomy and emails.
Just a quick reminder that we need feedback from you before we can continue with this one.

Hi Jamie

This interface looks good and is a very straightforward way of entering data. Some questions and comments:

I think we do have a spreadsheet for an initial upload of 600 sessions – I think you said you could process a spreadsheet, but can you confirm?

Sport vs discipline – We only need to show the Sport field.

We also need to be able to indicate if a session has medals associated. This will be yes/no or true/false in the spreadsheet, but it would be good if we could indicate this graphically by means of a medal icon (we can provide this).

Time – apparently it is not as straightforward as morning, afternoon, evening session, as some sessions straddle more than one time period ☹ Is it possible to make this field a time field with data such as ‘10.00 – 14.00’?

The field you have called ‘Extra information’ should be called ‘Session description’. This will need to accommodate information on more than one line i.e. with para returns e.g.
‘Men’s Singles, Doubles: preliminaries
Women’s Singles, Doubles: preliminaries
Mixed Doubles: preliminaries’

Name – I am not sure what this field relates to. Could you change it to Session code – we would use this for the unique session code for each event e.g. ‘BD001’, ‘BD002’.

Can we change the order the fields appear in so they run:
Session code
Sport
Venue
Date
Time of day
Session details

Otherwise this looks great to me.

If we need to go in and edit any records, how would we do so – will there be an interface where we can easily track down an individual session record to edit it?

In terms of designing the interface for search and results, is it possible to create a mock-up (or would you like me to do this – I could probably even get one designed by Cogapp except we only need something very simple). The template must also include promos for Tickets and for Prestige Ticketing in addition to the search/results interface. Can you advise?

Thanks!

Morag

Oops, just realised I left Medal out of the field order below. So it would run:
Session code
Sport
Venue
Date
Time of day
Medal
Session details

Excel: we do but the data needs to be well formatted (all the values need to match up to our sport names for example) dates must be in a consistent format etc.

Medals: will add

Other stuffL: will change

Name: it's just the unique name of the record (ie. what will show in the list view interface) will change to session code

Editing: yes you'll just use that interface, it's similar to suppliers or the current events editor etc.

In terms of design, it may be worth you just drawing a back of a napkin style example of what your expecting, but happy to work up a design based on that.

Jamie

Here is the data entry screen with amended fields
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/data/competitionsessions

I have sent a separate email with lockup designs attached, but probably best to keep comments / feedback to this ticket.

thanks

Jamie

This looks good. Some comments:

Can we make the date field based on dropdown dates 25 July right through to 12 August
We talked about making the name autogenerate based on sport plus date – can this be done?
Not sure if this interface is supposed to be fully working but it doesn’t allow me to save a record
What would the interface look like for searching for a record in order to update it?

Otherwise looks good!

Can you advise what the process would be for doing a mass upload based on a spreadsheet (and ideally using test data to do a quick test)?

Thanks!

The interface for searching would be the same as events etc. basically a free text search in the top tight of the page, I'd imagine that would drill you down enough (as an editor) and if you knew the session code it would get you to it direct.

Juggling a couple of things right now, so will come back and answer all your questions properly tomorrow!

thanks

Jamie

Hi there

Are you able to update me on progress on this? Am off from Tues evening so keen to ensure I have left everything in a state which someone else can pick up!

Thanks

Morag

Kieran spent one day this, Feb 8.
Getting feed working to import data from spreadsheet.
See: http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/data/competitionsessions
btw it's on staging here: http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/games/olympic-sport-competition-schedule/index.php
and searching by date is not currently working.
The schedule of events is on staging at http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/games/olympic-sport-competition-schedule/index.php awaiting feedback.
Marking as solved. http://www.london2012.com/games/olympic-sport-competition-schedule/index.php
